title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient, a right-hand dominant retiree, presents with bilateral hand numbness and tingling that began in January 2025 without trauma or injection. Symptoms have been waking her at night but have improved with nighttime bracing. She denies pain and limited motion.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Bilateral upper extremity skin is clear, intact without rash, minimal soft tissue swelling, minimal tenderness to palpation.

title: Imaging Results
content: X-rays of the right hand demonstrate variable joint space narrowing throughout the IP joints, most notably at the thumb MCP joint. Left hand shows severe joint space narrowing at the carpometacarpal joint.

title: Plan
content: Nerve studies are recommended. Follow-up in 6-8 weeks. Consideration for carpal tunnel treatment.
